name: nextcloud-tables
description: Nextcloud Tables allows users to create database-like tables with custom fields, filtering, and permissions directly in Nextcloud. It's ideal for low-code data tracking within a self-hosted ecosystem.
features: Custom tables: Create database-like tables with custom columns and data types.
Field types: Support for text, numbers, dates, selections, checkboxes, and more.
Data filtering: Filter rows by column values with multiple conditions and operators.
Sorting options: Order data by any column in ascending or descending order.
Row management: Add, edit, delete, and duplicate rows with spreadsheet-like interface.
Sharing and permissions: Share tables with users or groups with view or edit access.
Import/export: Load data from CSV files or export tables for backup and analysis.
Views and layouts: Create different views of the same data with custom filters and columns.
Collaboration: Multiple users can edit tables simultaneously with real-time updates.
API access: Integrate tables with external applications via REST API.
Nextcloud integration: Access tables from Nextcloud interface with unified authentication.
Low-code solution: Build simple databases and tracking systems without programming knowledge.
